intro: Iris petri, commonly known as the petri iris, is a species of flowering plant belonging to the Iridaceae family. It is characterized by its tall, slender stems and striking blue or violet flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full sunlight. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, forming a dense rosette at the base. Iris petri is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and botanical collections.
